Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Cup
Description: Fragment of a cylindrical cup with pointed rim, straight walls with a slight curvature near the bottom, and a vertical oval-sectioned handle. It is made from pink-coloured paste and the surface is covered with a coating of the same colour. The body presents a painted decoration of horizontal lotus flowers, with two symmetrically arranged buds on either side of these. The motifs are outlined in black, while the interior is set off in red and in black strokes.
